00:00:02:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:02:020000.Dialogue: Look at us. Getting ready for a double date with actual women who publicly acknowledge they're our girlfriends.

00:00:09:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:09:210000.Dialogue: Yes, actual women are the best.

00:00:13:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:13:060000.Dialogue: I don't understand. What other kind of women are there?

00:00:15:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:15:180000.Dialogue: Howard, artificial women are your department. You want to take this?

00:00:21:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:21:180000.Dialogue: No, it would just freak him out. Listen, before we leave, I should warn you, I'm a passionate man and I tend towards public displays of affection.

00:00:33:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:33:200000.Dialogue: What are you trying to tell me, Howard?

00:00:37:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:37:170000.Dialogue: There might be some making out in the car or the restaurant, and I don't want Bernadette to feel uncomfortable, so it would help if you and Penny made out, too.

00:00:46:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:46:040000.Dialogue: Don't worry. We're planning to have sex right on the salad bar.

00:00:55:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:55:220000.Dialogue: Good news! I rented us the fou r-hour edition of Watchmen.

00:01:03:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:03:220000.Dialogue: Well, then what are we going to do tonight?

00:01:06:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:06:070000.Dialogue: Uh, sorry, Raj. Howard and I are going out to dinner with Penny and Bernadette.

00:01:08:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:01:08:170000.Dialogue: Yeah. No more carefree bachelor nights for me and Leonard. These broncos have been saddled.

00:01:20:040000.Speaker: Leonard
00:01:20:040000.Dialogue: How did we get actual women?

00:01:22:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:22:050000.Dialogue: Great. They get girlfriends, and they just abandon us?

00:01:31:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:31:110000.Dialogue: Oh, yes. I just discovered I don't have enough room on my hard drive for a Linux partition, so you and I are going to perform a full backup, reinitialize and then reinstall all my operating systems.

00:01:41:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:41:150000.Dialogue: I don't want to do that.

00:01:44:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:44:030000.Dialogue: All right. Well, I'm going to perform full backup, reinitialize and then reinstall all my operating systems.

00:01:52:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:52:010000.Dialogue: Well, I understand there are several types of artificial women.

00:01:58:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:58:080000.Dialogue: Maybe you should look into that.

00:02:23:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:23:220000.Dialogue: Dude, there's so many cool things we could be doing tonight. Look. At the Glendale Galleria, "Put on your best zoot suit, "it's a salute to Swing music in the center court near Macy's. 5:00 p.m. to 9 p.m." Huh? Huh? A salute to zoot.

00:02:41:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:41:140000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, Raj, I have no desire to salute any article of clothing tonight. Much less one that's linked to race riots in the 1940s.

00:02:53:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:02:53:010000.Dialogue: Oh. I always thought that was some sort of after-Christmas sale.

00:03:01:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:01:200000.Dialogue: Well, then why don't we just go to the galleria and walk around?

00:03:03:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:03:200000.Dialogue: But I don't need anything at the Galleria. Do you need anything at the Galleria?

00:03:07:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:07:130000.Dialogue: No. We would just walk around and see what's what.

00:03:14:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:14:210000.Dialogue: Okay, well, how about this? From the university Web site: 00 p.m. to 10:00 p.m. , Norton Hall Multipurpose Room, "mixer for grad students and faculty "of the science and humanities departments. "Whether you split atoms or infinitives, this is the place to be."

00:03:37:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:37:140000.Dialogue: Come on, Sheldon, the world is filled with people doing things outside. Let's go outside. Outside is good.

00:03:45:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:03:45:090000.Dialogue: If outside is so good, why has mankind spent thousands of years trying to perfect inside?

00:03:50:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:50:040000.Dialogue: I don't know, it's a marketing scheme.

00:03:53:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:53:190000.Dialogue: Please, Sheldon, I'm a young, virile visitor from a foreign land and I need to strut my stuff.

00:04:00:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:00:170000.Dialogue: Let me offer you a compromise. Sometimes when I feel stifled and want a change of scenery, I use my imagination.

00:04:10:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:10:210000.Dialogue: One of my favorite places to visit is the two-dimensional world described in Edwin Abbott's mathematical fantasy, "Flatland."

00:04:18:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:18:090000.Dialogue: I don't want to go to Flatland.

00:04:21:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:21:000000.Dialogue: You're only saying that because you haven't been there.

00:04:26:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:26:030000.Dialogue: I am now a hexagon in two-dimensional space and can only perceive the edges of other objects.

00:04:35:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:35:050000.Dialogue: Is that you, Raj? I don't recognize your edge.

00:04:39:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:04:39:130000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I'm begging you. I want to go to this mixer, and I don't want to go alone.

00:04:44:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:44:050000.Dialogue: Well, you're in luck. There's a mixer here in Flatland.

00:04:51:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:04:51:050000.Dialogue: Oh, look, there's a sexually attractive line segment.

00:05:04:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:04:150000.Dialogue: I hope you're hungry, Bernadette. We're going to a terrific restaurant.

00:05:07:210000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:07:210000.Dialogue: Oh, yeah, I'm starved. When you spend all day in a bio-lab, watching flesh-eating bacteria skeletonize small rodents, it really works up an appetite.

00:05:16:210000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:16:210000.Dialogue: Flesh-eating bacteria. And yet, I still want to kiss this woman. What does that tell you?

00:05:22:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:22:050000.Dialogue: That you'd be willing to die a horrible death on the off-chance you'd get to second base?

00:05:27:060000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:27:060000.Dialogue: Oh, we're way past second base. Right, Howard?

00:05:30:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:05:30:100000.Dialogue: Well, we kind of disagree about what the bases are.

00:05:35:190000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:05:35:190000.Dialogue: How's your work going, Penny? Any acting jobs?

00:05:39:040000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:39:040000.Dialogue: Well, the last big thing I did was this production of Diary of Anne Frank above a bowling alley. But I think things might be turning around pretty soon.

00:05:49:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:49:100000.Dialogue: Well, promise you won't make fun of me.

00:05:51:150000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:51:150000.Dialogue: Of course, I would never make fun of you.

00:05:54:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:54:010000.Dialogue: Okay. Well, I went to this psychic who told me that if I cut my hair, I'm going to get a national commercial.

00:06:02:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:02:070000.Dialogue: Wh... Seriously? You're getting career advice from a psychic?

00:06:07:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:07:000000.Dialogue: Good job not making fun of her.

00:06:10:110000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:10:110000.Dialogue: She's not one of those phonies, okay. She wrote a book and has her own Web site.

00:06:15:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:15:030000.Dialogue: Oh, gee, why didn't you say so? They don't let just anyone have a Web site.

00:06:18:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:06:18:190000.Dialogue: Why are you being such a jerk?

00:06:21:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:21:070000.Dialogue: You're surprised? Your psychic tell you I was going to be a jerk?

00:06:29:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:29:230000.Dialogue: Why don't you kids go ahead and chat? We're gonna make out back here.

00:06:44:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:44:130000.Dialogue: Thanks for giving me your limited edition Green Lantern lantern.

00:06:48:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:48:020000.Dialogue: Did you really have to bring it in with you?

00:06:50:160000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:50:160000.Dialogue: What if evil strikes and my power ring runs low?

00:06:58:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:06:58:100000.Dialogue: Come on, let's get a drink.

00:07:00:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:00:100000.Dialogue: Yeah, well I do. And when my wingman is carrying a Green Lantern lantern, I drink a lot. I'll have a screwdriver, please. Don't be chintzy with the screw.

00:07:10:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:10:020000.Dialogue: I would like a root beer float.

00:07:12:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:12:190000.Dialogue: Sheldon, they don't have ice cream.

00:07:15:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:15:180000.Dialogue: They don't? Well, apparently, these people and I differ greatly on the definition of "party."

00:07:23:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:23:210000.Dialogue: And don't be chintzy with the Shirley.

00:07:29:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:29:020000.Dialogue: Okay, let's check out the females.

00:07:36:010000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:36:010000.Dialogue: That's Professor Wilkinson's wife. She's like 80 years old.

00:07:38:210000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:38:210000.Dialogue: But she's female. Isn't that the game?

00:07:40:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:40:170000.Dialogue: No. I'm looking for a hookup.

00:07:43:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:43:190000.Dialogue: Oh, yes. So, the point of this exercise is for you to find someone to copulate with?

00:07:49:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:49:190000.Dialogue: Not so loud, but ideally, yes.

00:07:56:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:56:180000.Dialogue: Thank you. And what is my function as "wingman?"

00:08:00:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:00:220000.Dialogue: You help me run my game.

00:08:07:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:07:030000.Dialogue: When I lie through my teeth to a woman, you nod and agree.

00:08:12:100000.Speaker: Girl
00:08:12:100000.Dialogue: Hey, that's pretty cool. What is it?

00:08:15:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:15:020000.Dialogue: It's a limited edition Green Lantern lantern. My friend is looking for someone to copulate with.

00:08:24:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:24:180000.Dialogue: I'm Sheldon. How do you do?

00:08:26:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:26:180000.Dialogue: Rajesh Ramayan Koothrappali. Call me Raj.

00:08:28:180000.Speaker: Abby
00:08:28:180000.Dialogue: Hi, Raj. Where are you from?

00:08:42:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:42:090000.Dialogue: I thought your father was a gynecologist. I'm sorry.

00:08:50:160000.Speaker: Abby
00:08:50:160000.Dialogue: Martha, come here. Meet Raj and Sheldon. This is my friend, Martha.

00:08:56:010000.Speaker: Martha
00:08:56:010000.Dialogue: Is that the limited edition Green Lantern lantern?

00:08:59:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:59:130000.Dialogue: "In brightest day, in darkest night, no evil shall escape my sight."

00:09:10:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:09:10:170000.Dialogue: Thank you. Have you chosen one to copulate with?

00:09:26:220000.Speaker: Bernadette
00:09:26:220000.Dialogue: So, what should we talk about?

00:09:31:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:31:180000.Dialogue: Well, we could always learn more about why people who believe in psychics are idiots. Leonard?

00:09:40:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:40:170000.Dialogue: Oh, we don't need to talk about that anymore. Leonard covered it pretty well in the car.

00:09:45:060000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:45:060000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, but facts are facts.

00:09:48:170000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:48:170000.Dialogue: Right, and if you can't understand it, it's not a fact.

00:09:52:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:52:010000.Dialogue: No, if it's not a fact, it's not a fact.

00:09:55:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:09:55:050000.Dialogue: Oh, got it. Thank you for educating me.

00:10:01:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:01:190000.Dialogue: Amazing. Would you like to try some?

00:10:04:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:04:030000.Dialogue: Yeah, sure. Well, the fact is, you can't. Come on, Howard, Bernadette, you're both scientists. Help me out here.

00:10:11:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:11:140000.Dialogue: What do you think-- want to jump right in the middle of another couple's argument?

00:10:17:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:17:180000.Dialogue: Maybe we should just stop talking about this.

00:10:20:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:10:20:230000.Dialogue: Maybe some of us should stop talking altogether.

00:10:30:230000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:30:230000.Dialogue: You know, the best thing about being in a committed, monogamous, mutually supportive relationship is that even if you have different ideas, you can have a spirited debate, yet still care for, even make love with...

00:10:49:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:49:110000.Dialogue: I knew you were going to do that. Doesn't make me psychic!

00:11:32:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:32:170000.Dialogue: What the hell is eighth base?

00:11:38:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:38:080000.Dialogue: Well, my shirt. How'd things go with Penny?

00:11:50:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:50:020000.Dialogue: Are we taking our relationship frustrations out on innocent Cylons?

00:11:54:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:54:140000.Dialogue: It's not just Cylons. Superman's next.

00:11:58:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:58:200000.Dialogue: All right, I was going to try to squeeze in a little more mocking before lunch, but I can come back later when you don't have a high-powered weapon.

00:12:06:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:06:200000.Dialogue: How can I go out with a woman who believes in psychics?

00:12:10:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:10:230000.Dialogue: Hey, I once dated a girl who believed she was abducted by aliens.

00:12:16:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:16:140000.Dialogue: Au contraire. It meant she was gullible and open to a little probing.

00:12:20:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:20:220000.Dialogue: What am I supposed to do, pretend I believe something I don't whenever I'm with Penny?

00:12:25:200000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:25:200000.Dialogue: Hey, I'm sure Penny fakes all kinds of things when she's with you.

00:12:31:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:31:110000.Dialogue: Do me a favor-- lean over, put your head right here.

00:12:35:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:35:070000.Dialogue: Let me show you another way to look at this. Here we have the universe of all women. These are the ones you want to sleep with. These are the women who believe exactly what you believe. These are the women who would be willing to sleep with you.

00:12:52:170000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:52:170000.Dialogue: And right there in the little triple intersection... is your ideal mate. Odds are she's a short physicist with low self-esteem who lives in a government research facility in China.

00:13:03:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:03:070000.Dialogue: What's your point? In order to keep having a sexual relationship with Penny, I have to give up everything I believe in-- my intellectual integrity, the very nature of who I am? I can't do that, Howard.

00:13:28:030000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:13:28:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:28:030000.Dialogue: The dog... koira. The roof... katto. Grapes... ryp leet.

00:13:48:060000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:13:48:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:13:54:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:13:54:050000.Speaker: Raj

00:13:56:110000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:13:56:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:56:110000.Dialogue: It means "come in." It's taking forever to load the new operating system on my computer. I disinfected the kitchen and the bathroom, and now I thought I'd learn Finnish.

00:14:09:130000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:14:09:130000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:09:130000.Dialogue: That's Hindi for "Whatever floats your boat." Uh, listen, I got a text from that girl Abby, and she and her friend Martha want to hang out with us again. What do you say?

00:14:19:150000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:14:19:150000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:19:150000.Dialogue: I don't say anything. I merely offer you a facial expression that suggests you've gone insane.

00:14:27:100000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:14:27:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:27:100000.Dialogue: I don't get it. You had a great time.

00:14:29:030000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:14:29:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:29:030000.Dialogue: Yes, exactly, I had a great time. That's done; I've moved on to other things. For example, after I learn Finnish, I'm not going to learn Finnish again.

00:14:36:170000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:14:36:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:36:170000.Dialogue: Please, Sheldon, I'm a lost Indian boy far from home, and I want a girlfriend and I want her to be Abby, and she'll only come over if she can bring Martha.

00:14:46:090000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:14:46:090000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:46:090000.Dialogue: Raj, I highly doubt there is any argument you can make, threat you might levy, rhetorical strategy, plea, invocation, supplication, or... vetoomus that you can employ that would convince me to reconsider.

00:15:15:140000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:15:15:140000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:15:140000.Dialogue: My Incredible Hulk hands signed by Stan Lee.

00:15:21:060000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:15:21:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:40:180000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:15:40:180000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:15:44:110000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:15:44:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:44:110000.Dialogue: So does that mean we can go with the girls again?

00:15:46:070000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:15:46:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:15:46:070000.Dialogue: Hulk agree to second date with puny humans!

00:15:53:210000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:15:53:210000.Speaker: Raj
00:15:53:210000.Dialogue: You can't wear the hands on the date.

00:15:58:050000.Scene: The apartment. Sheldon is learning Finnish.
00:15:58:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:16:03:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:03:200000.Dialogue: Hey. Cleaning out the old dryer lint, huh? Not only is it courteous, it's safety smart. Every year, 15,000 fires are caused by accidental dryer lint ignition. Now you're supposed to say, "Wow, what an interesting fact. "Come here, you crazy, nerdy guy. I could never be mad at you."

00:16:28:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:28:120000.Dialogue: Wow, that's all you got after you were the most obnoxious person on a double date that included Howard Wolowitz?

00:16:38:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:38:050000.Dialogue: No, I'm sorry. I really am. It's not right to mock what a person believes in.

00:16:44:060000.Speaker: Penny
00:16:44:060000.Dialogue: Thank you. Would you be willing to go to my psychic and see what it's all about?

00:16:48:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:48:220000.Dialogue: Would you be willing to read a book that concisely explains how all psychics are frauds?

00:17:00:130000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:00:130000.Dialogue: Okay, let's go see your psychic.

00:17:04:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:04:030000.Dialogue: Well, yeah, one of us has to keep an open mind.

00:17:06:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:06:150000.Dialogue: You saying I don't have an open mind?

00:17:07:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:07:220000.Dialogue: No, n-not at all. Let me help you with this stuff.

00:17:09:200000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:09:200000.Dialogue: You know, I believe in ghosts, too.

00:17:15:050000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:15:050000.Dialogue: I know, and pyramid power and healing crystals.

00:17:19:050000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:19:050000.Dialogue: Oh, no, no, no, crystals don't work.

00:17:22:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:22:170000.Dialogue: Really, that's the line? Psychics are real, but crystals are voodoo?

00:17:28:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:28:100000.Dialogue: Oh, voodoo's real. You don't want to mess with voodoo.

00:17:34:120000.Speaker: Martha
00:17:34:120000.Dialogue: Flatland is more than just a mathematical essay. It is also a treatise on Victorian social mores.

00:17:40:100000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:40:100000.Dialogue: You know, I had never considered that.

00:17:46:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:17:46:030000.Dialogue: Wow, that's going to completely change my visits there.

00:18:29:220000.Speaker: Martha
00:18:29:220000.Dialogue: Listen, they're kind of getting busy in the living room, and... I was wondering if I could hang out in here for a while.

00:18:38:050000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:18:38:050000.Dialogue: Well, I suppose. Come in. I'll sleep in Leonard's room. Good night.
